content:
• Friday, August 3, 2012
  • SHCAY

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY) fell 28.1% in Tokyo after warning it expected a ¥100B ($1.28B) operating...

    Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY) fell 28.1% in Tokyo after warning it expected a ¥100B ($1.28B) operating loss this fiscal year, announcing 5K job cuts, and getting downgraded by Moody's and S&P. In response, Foxconn parent Hon Hai (OTCPK:HNHAF) says it isn't obligated to go through with plans to buy a 9.9% stake in Sharp at a higher price, but Sharp feels differently. The dispute could have implications for Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), which relies on both companies, and might have tapped them to help build a TV.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) receives a stop-work order for its Ebola virus therapeutics...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) receives a stop-work order for its Ebola virus therapeutics from the U.S. Department of Defense due to budget constraints. The order will remain in effect until September 1, when a final decision will be made on the ultimate future of the program. Shares -3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) was one of the day's better tech performers. Short-covering helped (21.6M...

    Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) was one of the day's better tech performers. Short-covering helped (21.6M shares were shorted as of July 13), as did a positive note from Piper's Andrew Nowinski about the company's storage appliance software and partnership with NetApp. Nowinski, a long-time bull, notes the appliance software allows FIO's flash modules to better service multiple servers. Lazard, however, questions how interested server partners will be in selling it.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI +8.9%) continued its recent rally after posting Q2 results, which were in-line with...

    Rovi (ROVI +8.9%) continued its recent rally after posting Q2 results, which were in-line with the guidance it provided in a July 17 warning. Possibly helping is a mildly bullish note from Pac Crest, which speculates Rovi could reach $20 if  its legal battles conclude favorably. The company tried to strike a positive tone about those battles during its earnings call, and its ability to improve slumping margins. Rovi also guided for 2013 revenue growth of 5%-10%, largely below a 9.2% consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • AIG

    AIG reopens for trade following the Treasury announcement to sell $4.5B of stock (and AIG to buy...

    AIG reopens for trade following the Treasury announcement to sell $4.5B of stock (and AIG to buy 2/3 of it). Up a little more than 1% ahead of the announcement, shares +0.5% now.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (RBCN -12.8%) plunges once more thanks to the guidance accompanying its Q2 beat. The...

    Rubicon (RBCN -12.8%) plunges once more thanks to the guidance accompanying its Q2 beat. The maker of sapphire wafers for LED chip production expects Q3 revenue of $18M-$21M and EPS of -$0.02 to -$0.05, below a consensus of $22.7M and $0.01. Rubicon also predicts pricing for 2"-4" wafers "will likely remain low for another quarter or two." LEDS -5.9% in sympathy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • KCG

    Knight Capital (KCG +63%) soars as TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) begins again routing trades to...

    Knight Capital (KCG +63%) soars as TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) begins again routing trades to the firm. Knight is a "good and trusted partner." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (SNY +4.8%) is higher today after the FDA approves Zaltrap, a drug developed by SNY and...

    Sanofi (SNY +4.8%) is higher today after the FDA approves Zaltrap, a drug developed by SNY and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +1%) for the treatment of advanced colon cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • MHK

    Carpeting and flooring company Mohawk Industries (MHK +4.5%) moves up today after beating on its...

    Carpeting and flooring company Mohawk Industries (MHK +4.5%) moves up today after beating on its bottom line Q2 late yesterday. However, negative currency impacts weighed on its top line as total revenue slipped. Net earnings rose 20% Y/Y however, on improved margins, higher selling prices and lower interest costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • FB

    Risk assets are popular today, and that includes Facebook (FB +9.3%), which is halting a string...

    Risk assets are popular today, and that includes Facebook (FB +9.3%), which is halting a string of ugly post-earnings declines in impressive fashion. With ~13% of the float shorted, short-covering is likely playing a role. Ealier today, Evercore's Ken Sena (previous) went on CNBC (video) to advise investors stay on the sidelines until Facebook's lock-up expiration, which will more than triple its float over the next 2 months to 1.4B shares, is finished.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • UDRL

    Union Drilling (UDRL +22.1%) gushes higher following an upgrade to Outperform from BMO. The firm...

    Union Drilling (UDRL +22.1%) gushes higher following an upgrade to Outperform from BMO. The firm notes UDRL has an enterprise value of just $3.5M/rig, the lowest in its coverage universe, and thinks its valuation is (or perhaps now was) barely above equipment salvage value. BMO doesn't think this makes sense, given its belief UDRL "is in little danger of failing to meet its debt obligations." Shares soared yesterday as well, thanks to a Q2 beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI +2.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at TheStreet Ratings,...

    Baker Hughes (BHI +2.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at TheStreet Ratings, citing its revenue growth potential a strong balance sheet metrics. Most notably, the company's debt-to-equity ratio is low, indicating good debt management, and net income growth has significantly exceeded both that of its peers and the S&P 500 as a whole.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA +12.4%) soars after beating estimates and announcing two acquisitions. One of...

    Synaptics (SYNA +12.4%) soars after beating estimates and announcing two acquisitions. One of them, Pacinian, gives Synaptics a notebook keyboard solution that's 40% thinner than alternatives, while the other, an Integrated Device (NASDAQ:IDTI) unit, provides LCD interface and panel refresh tech. FQ1 guidance is below consensus, but the Street is focusing on the fact a Synaptics in-cell touch controller appears to be in the next iPhone. Rivals are underperforming: CY +0.1%. ATML -0.2%. (transcript) 

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -4.6%) loses power after its Q2 swung to a loss on impairment charges....

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -4.6%) loses power after its Q2 swung to a loss on impairment charges. Total revenue fell 22% Y/Y, as lower natural gas prices weighed on the energy producer's bottom-line results. Total equivalent production rose 12%. The average realized price, including hedging impacts, fell 27% for natural gas while oil prices increased 4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • PKI

    Shares of PerkinElmer (PKI +9%) rally after beating on its Q2 EPS target this morning. Net...

    Shares of PerkinElmer (PKI +9%) rally after beating on its Q2 EPS target this morning. Net earnings increased 13% Y/Y on double-digit revenue growth in its health care business and stronger margins. Revenue from its human health business rose 18%, while its environmental health segment saw an anemic 1.2% increase. Gross margins also rose to 45.8% from 43.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • MSFT

    Investors may have soured on Facebook, but they still love LinkedIn (LNKD +14.1%), whose booming...

    Investors may have soured on Facebook, but they still love LinkedIn (LNKD +14.1%), whose booming job listings business fueled a Q2 sales beat and guidance hike. LinkedIn is less dependent on ads (28% of revenue) than Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), and that makes mobile far less of a threat. Goldman (Buy) is encouraged by new revenue streams such as Sales Navigator, but Evercore (Equal Weight) remains worried about LinkedIn's valuation. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • AWK

    American Water Works (AWK +3%) trades at new year highs after its Q2 bottom-line beat Street...

    American Water Works (AWK +3%) trades at new year highs after its Q2 bottom-line beat Street expectations late yesterday. Net income rose 32% Y/Y as higher water use and expansion into attractive markets boosted its revenue and better cost controls improved margins. Hot, dry weather in a number of its states led to record pumpage, which the company believes added $0.06 - $0.09 per share to its EPS for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +6.7%) jumps following its Q2 report. The results aren't great: revenue of $6.5M...

    Immersion (IMMR +6.7%) jumps following its Q2 report. The results aren't great: revenue of $6.5M (-3% Y/Y) missed by $1.3M and EPS of -$0.08 was in-line. However, Immersion said on its earnings call it could reach new licensing deals by year's end that would allow it to reach the high end of its 2012 revenue guidance range of $32M-$38M (consensus is for $35.1M). Also, the company announced Fujitsu has released the first smartphone containing Immersion's HD Haptics tech.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • USO

    Looking like a peripheral European stock market, oil rockets higher, perhaps heartened by the...

    Looking like a peripheral European stock market, oil rockets higher, perhaps heartened by the reassessment of the ECB's plans and better news on the U.S. jobs front. USO +4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • CBS

    Shares of CBS (CBS +5.4%) rally off of a strong Q2 report. A nice trend from the media player is...

    Shares of CBS (CBS +5.4%) rally off of a strong Q2 report. A nice trend from the media player is its evolving revenue diversity - with syndication, retransmission fees, and digital carving out a bigger piece of the pie to make up for the crumbling of traditional advertising. (earnings, CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • XIDEQ

    Battery maker Exide Technologies (XIDE +2.8%) powers back into the green from an early...

    Battery maker Exide Technologies (XIDE +2.8%) powers back into the green from an early pre-market pasting that had the shares down over 13% on the back of wider FQ1 losses that disappointed the Street. The company attributes the miss to a substantial valuation-allowance charge and lighter revenue, as it contends with steep restructuring expenses, weak demand and higher input costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +10.3%) is one of the S&P 500's best performers this morning, after its...

    EOG Resources (EOG +10.3%) is one of the S&P 500's best performers this morning, after its Q2 results easily beat estimates late yesterday. Net income rose 34% Y/Y on sharply higher oil output-benefit results, which can be attributed to the company's aggressive shift out of natural gas and into heavier liquids production. Crude oil and condensate volumes rose 52% while prices fell 4.6%. Natural-gas-liquids volume rose 42% as prices were down 35%. Natural-gas volumes sank 1.1% as prices tanked nearly 39%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -16%) takes a hit after pricing its 5.5M share offering at $5, a 13%...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -16%) takes a hit after pricing its 5.5M share offering at $5, a 13% discount to yesterday's close. The placement pricing is a significant haircut from its intitial filing back in June, when the stock was trading north of $12. The gross proceeds are expected to be approximately $27.5M. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund its operations, as well as other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE +9.6%) pops after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm predicts...

    Demandware (DWRE +9.6%) pops after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm predicts organic growth will go from 26% in 2012 to 36% in 2013, and argues the broader environment for e-commerce solutions remains healthy in spite of macro weakness. Holiday season demand is seen as a catalyst for Demandware, which has underperformed thanks to worries about the company's European exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • MCPIQ

    The Rare Earth ETF (REMX +0.5%) pulls off a nice trick, edging higher despite the plunge in...

    The Rare Earth ETF (REMX +0.5%) pulls off a nice trick, edging higher despite the plunge in Molycorp (MCP -26%), 7.95% of the fund's assets. Also, its top holding - Australia's Iluka Resources (8.2% of assets) - fell 5.5% overnight.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • TDC

    Teradata (TDC +6.3%) jumps after announcing Malaysian carrier DiGi will expand its use of the...

    Teradata (TDC +6.3%) jumps after announcing Malaysian carrier DiGi will expand its use of the company's data warehousing and analytical database solutions, which have already led the company to be hyped up as a big data play. But it could just be the Street has become more bullish after taking a closer look at yesterday morning's Q2 report, in which Teradata raised its 2012 EPS guidance range to $2.72-$2.82 (consensus is for $2.69). (CC transcript) Update: Sterne Agee has upgraded Teradata. "Analytics remains a strategic buy for most Global enterprises and 2H12 guidance appears beatable."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • ELOQ

    Eloqua (ELOQ +8.9%) failed to jump out of the gates yesterday following its IPO, but shares have...

    Eloqua (ELOQ +8.9%) failed to jump out of the gates yesterday following its IPO, but shares have rallied strongly since then, and are now up 21.7% from their $11.50 offering price. The cloud marketing software vendor now sports a market cap of $413M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Some of the air comes out of the post-earnings resurgence of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters...

    Some of the air comes out of the post-earnings resurgence of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.4%) as shares fall off to $21.77 on heavy trading. A lot of the action this week on GMCR has been tied to a battle to force out late-charging shorts, according to some traders. On the Street, Janney Capital is back to its bullish vibe, saying fair market value for the coffee stock is a lofty $60.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +4.2%) moves up on talk that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.2%) is...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +4.2%) moves up on talk that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.2%) is considering a bid as high as $128 for the company. That might be an expensive price tag for a "one trick pony," however, considering company has only one commercially approved drug, Solaris, whose distincion is that it's considered the most expensive drug on the market - with an average cost of over $400k per patient.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -4.7%) heads south following its Q2 report. While results matched those in last...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -4.7%) heads south following its Q2 report. While results matched those in last week's preannouncement,  Glu is guiding for Q3 revenue of $20.25M-$21.25M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.07, below a consensus of $22.9M and -$0.04. During its earnings call, Glu blamed the timing of upcoming game launches. The company also disclosed it paid $2.8M to acquire GameSpy Technology from IGN, and that 64% of its Q2 smartphone revenue came from iOS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • MELI

    Shares of MercadoLibre (MELI +20.5%) run hot after beating estimates with its Q2 report and...

    Shares of MercadoLibre (MELI +20.5%) run hot after beating estimates with its Q2 report and scoring an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight to Neutral. The Latin American e-commerce player saw confirmed users rise a solid 25% Y/Y to 73.2M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • DLB

    Dolby (DLB -12%) plunges following its FQ3 miss, which had much to do with soft electronics...

    Dolby (DLB -12%) plunges following its FQ3 miss, which had much to do with soft electronics demand. During its earnings call, Dolby noted PC revenue fell 10% Y/Y and consumer electronics revenue (tied to DVD/Blu-ray players) fell 19%. TV and mobile revenue rose Y/Y but fell sharply Q/Q; the former was hurt by lower shipments, and the latter by the timing of royalty payments. Dolby expects FY12 revenue of $900M-$920M and EPS of $2.35-$2.43, below a consensus of $944M and $2.57.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • PG

    Procter & Gamble (PG +3.1%) CFO Jon Mueller tips off on an earnings CC (webcast) that the...

    Procter & Gamble (PG +3.1%) CFO Jon Mueller tips off on an earnings CC (webcast) that the firm is using promotional activity to preserve market share with blades and razors- two categories with typically lush margins. He also says P&G will roll back its price increase on powder detergents after seeing sales slump. (call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • VIVHY

    Speculation that Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is reportedly shelving plans to find a buyer for its $8B,...

    Speculation that Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is reportedly shelving plans to find a buyer for its $8B, 61% stake in Activision (ATVI -5.7%) is followed by the latter selling off on account of its Q2 report, with strong sales of Skylanders merchandise outweighed by tepid guidance and a major drop in World of Warcraft subs. (ATVI transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -5.5%) slump after posting a largely in-line Q2 report. On an earnings CC,...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG -5.5%) slump after posting a largely in-line Q2 report. On an earnings CC, execs say the company will leverage its first mover advantage in the tablet keyboard space with new products to be introduced in front of the holiday season and early next year at CES.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • HNT

    Health Net (NYSE:HNT) plunges 25% after yet again cutting earnings guidance for the year, now to...

    Health Net (NYSE:HNT) plunges 25% after yet again cutting earnings guidance for the year, now to a range of $1.45-$1.55, despite an EPS beat today aided by a $119.4M gain on sale of discontinued operations (net income was $124.6M). It cut guidance heavily last quarter. Revenues for fiscal 2012 are reaffirmed at $11B-$11.5B.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • ARR

    ARMOUR Residential (ARR -3%) tumbles after last night's earnings report was accompanied by a...

    ARMOUR Residential (ARR -3%) tumbles after last night's earnings report was accompanied by a secondary offering of 55M shares that had to be coming given the shares' premium to book value (8.6% before the offering). It's the 2nd offering in a month and 4th in the last 8 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 20 Comments
  • BODY

    Shares of Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) fall apart, down 12.5% premarket, after the retailer lowers...

    Shares of Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) fall apart, down 12.5% premarket, after the retailer lowers its outlook for Q3 as sales slump and higher markdowns undercut profitability. The action follows a broader theme in retail of shoppers shying away from higher-end and specialty stores in favor of mid-priced department stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) soars 19.3% premarket off of promising Q2 numbers and guidance (I, II)....

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) soars 19.3% premarket off of promising Q2 numbers and guidance (I, II). The results were striking enough to prompt Oppenheimer to upgrade the name to Outperform from Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • CAR

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP) get crushed, down 34.8% premarket, after the firm's forecast for revenue...

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP) get crushed, down 34.8% premarket, after the firm's forecast for revenue deflates the spirit of investors. Though the ride-sharing company narrowed its quarterly loss, it's adding fewer new customers than it anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) +8.8% after reaching a patent licensing deal with NEC, one of the...

    VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) +8.8% after reaching a patent licensing deal with NEC, one of the companies it has been suing. VirnetX will receive a one-time licensing payment, and an ongoing royalty on sales of NEC VoIP gear featuring encryption technology. VirnetX reached deals with Aastra and Mitel, two other litigants, earlier this year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -15.3%) is downgraded to underweight at JPMorgan, whose Mike Gambardella unloaded...

    Molycorp (MCP -15.3%) is downgraded to underweight at JPMorgan, whose Mike Gambardella unloaded on management in last night's earnings call. "I'm a bit shocked at this call because its seems to be a total disconnect from what the management is saying and what you put down in your outlook" regarding funding issues. (earnings)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • OPEN

    Premarket gainers: OPEN +19%. MELI +17%. SKUL +13%. LNKD +11%. ATPG +11%. VHC +10%. KOG +10%....

    Premarket gainers: OPEN +19%. MELI +17%. SKUL +13%. LNKD +11%. ATPG +11%. VHC +10%. KOG +10%. KCG +10%. STEM +8%. SQNM +8%. DB +7%. ING +7%. WFR +7%. E +6%. SI +5%. MT +5%. ATAX +5%. BCS +5%.
    Losers: ZIP -35%. HNT -24%. OTCQB:BODY -18%. MCP -15%. XIDE -13%. REE -8%. GLUU -7%. ONNN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NILE

    Shares of Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) skyrocket 27.1% premarket after the company beat estimates...

    Shares of Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) skyrocket 27.1% premarket after the company beat estimates with its Q2 report. The company's full-year guidance of $0.70-$0.85 came in over the consensus mark of analysts and brings up the question if the company is catching jewelry buyers trading down from higher-priced brick-and-mortar sellers such as SIG, TIF and ZLC.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • KGC

    A swap of CEOs at Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) has stoked up rumors of a takeover bid, according to a...

    A swap of CEOs at Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) has stoked up rumors of a takeover bid, according to a Bloomberg report. Shares +2.2% premarket, -34.9% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • SIEGY

    Siemens (SI +4.5% in Frankfurt) has started a €3B stock buyback, as approved at its annual...

    Siemens (SI +4.5% in Frankfurt) has started a €3B stock buyback, as approved at its annual meeting in January 2011, the conglomerate said late yesterday. Siemens will use the program to reduce stock, for employee compensation, and for convertible and warrant bonds. Siemens is also canceling 33M treasury shares worth €2.23B, based on yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 AM

  • EU stocks open higher following yesterday's sharp sell-off after Mario Draghi's failure to...

    EU stocks open higher following yesterday's sharp sell-off after Mario Draghi's failure to please, and head of job numbers in the U.S. later. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.9%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.9%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Madrid +0.9%, Milan +1.5%. Spanish 10-year yields +15 bps to 7.31%, Italy +3 bps to 6.36%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian shares are mostly lower after Mario Draghi follows the Fed's inaction with his own,...

    Asian shares are mostly lower after Mario Draghi follows the Fed's inaction with his own, relative to his macho talk, while earnings from Japanese tech companies also aren't helping, with Sharp losing almost a third of its value. Japan -1.1%, Hong Kong -0.9%, China +0.8%, India -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 AM
